definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Looking at the cave with stalactites and statues, how also get a few million years?
sentences.chinese: 看着洞裏的鐘乳石和石佛像，怎麼也得個幾萬年吧？

sentences.english: A stalagmite is below a stalactite and they both grow, eventually to meet.
sentences.chinese: 石筍在鐘乳石下面，它們二者都在增長，最終會合。

sentences.english: Seepage flow can be observed in stalactite caves.
sentences.chinese: 在鐘乳石溶洞裏，可以見到滲流現象。

sentences.english: There was also a small waterfall with brightly colored stalactites.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個小瀑布和一些有着明亮顏色鐘乳石。

sentences.english: This is already inside the dragon's body, everywhere are these weird stalactites .
sentences.chinese: 這已經是在龍肚裏面了，到處都是奇形怪狀的鐘乳石。

sentences.english: Stalagmites and stalactites? You never know when those school lessons will come in handy.
sentences.chinese: 石筍和鐘乳石？你才知道學校的課程在哪兒能用上。

sentences.english: Once a stalactite and a stalagmite are connected, then it is called a column.
sentences.chinese: 當鐘乳石與石筍連在一起，稱之爲圓柱。

sentences.english: At that time, Kang text heel I secretly touched a clock milk a stone a wood.
sentences.chinese: 當時，康文跟我偷偷摸到鐘乳石林。

sentences.english: The nose is a manifest congealed drop or stalactite.
sentences.chinese: 鼻子，很明顯，是一個凝聚了的水滴，或鐘乳石。

sentences.english: Mix of the stalactite cave, strange shapes.
sentences.chinese: 洞中的鐘乳石千姿百態，形狀奇特。

sentences.english: Please do not hold your head high, or you might knock your head against some protruding stalactite .
sentences.chinese: 請別高昂着頭，否則你的頭可能撞到突出的鐘乳石上。

sentences.english: Amazing climbing on tufas and stalagtites.
sentences.chinese: 在石灰華和鐘乳石上進行攀爬。

sentences.english: Most of the stalactites and stalagmites have their own names.
sentences.chinese: 多數鐘乳石和石筍都有自己的名字。

definition: Qutang Gorge, 8 km long gorge on the Changjiang or Yangtze in Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2 qing4], the upper of the Three Gorges 三峽|三峡[San1 Xia2]
